section.title: Module
section.para: Just as the is the beneficiary's view of the Letter of Credit, this (SR) module is the beneficiary's view of the Standby LC.

Whereas the module is for use by the applicant, this module provides the beneficiary with a notification of the terms issued in his favour, and a way to send further transactional messages to his advising banks on those records.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, the terms "SR", "Received Standby Letter Of Credit" and "Received Standby LC" are used interchangeably.

section.title: Overview
section.para: This module enables you, on behalf of your company (the beneficiary), to receive notification of Standby Letters of Credit, and subsequent amendments or updates, from the Advising Bank. You can also send messages back to the bank for events that require your approval in the ongoing transaction flow, or to initiate a transfer.

section.title: Received Standby Letter of Credit Landing Page
section.para: The Received Standby Letter of Credit Landing page displays a list of SR transactions that are in various stages of an SR life cycle. The Landing page view is customizable based on your requirement.

note.para: You can customise the list of columns displayed through SDK.

section.para: The following image illustrates the Received Standby Letter of Credit landing page:

note.para: Lists of columns displayed are customizable through SDK.

section.para:
The following ribbon items enable you perform various actions on individual SR transactions or in bulk, based on the tab you are on. Individual tabs and related functionality are described below:
Refer section Information on Action for details on actions available on each of the listed ribbon items.
Live
Lists all the approved Received Standby Letter of Credit records and the expired Received Standby Letter of Credit records by the bank.
Draft
Lists all SR transactions in draft state. You can Edit, View, Discard or view the history of events that Received Standby Letter of Credit has gone through, through Details action.
Actions
Lists all the Received Standby Letters of Credit transactions on which the bank has requested client action.
Pending Approval
Lists all existing Received Standby Letters of Credit transactions that are awaiting client approval.
The Authorise action item is available only for a checker user.
A user with batch submission permission can select multiple transactions to Approve or Return though the checkbox provided for every transactions listed in this tab.
It is mandatory to provide the comments to return a transaction.
Pending at Bank
Lists all existing Received Standby Letters of Credit transactions that are awaiting bank approval.
Rejected
Lists all the rejected Received Standby Letter of Credit records by the bank. The status given to such ELs is "Not Processed".
Closed
Lists all the Received Standby Letters of Credit transactions that have been marked as purged by the Remitting Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.

The Advance Filter presents you with various filter options like Event, Entity, Applicant, Currency and Expiry Date. Enter the relevant search criterion and apply the filter to list all the relevant SR transactions. You can also select the time frame for which data needs to be fetched.

You can perform the following actions on the listed SR transactions:
Search: Enter any of the Advance Filter search criterion in the search box to display the required list of LCs
CSV Download: Download the list of LCs displayed on the dashboard. Click on the Download icon to list the formats in which the files can be downloaded. You can download Current Data or Full Data.
Current Data: Downloads the transactions displayed on screen.
Full Data: Downloads all the transactions available under a particular status tab like Draft, Rejected and more.
Column Filter: Add the column filter value to narrow down the search criterion for the listed LCs.

section.title: Transaction Details
section.para:
This section describes the information presented on clicking any of the following actions against any given transaction:
Details
Return
Approve

entry.para: Field
Description

Displays the transaction details, all the events of transaction, attachments and charges associated with the transaction. The information is spread over three tabs 'Transaction Details', 'Events' and 'Additional Information'. Individual tabs are described below:
Click on Received Standby LC Landing button at the top of Details page to navigate back to Received Standby LC Landing page.
Click on Journey button at the top of Details page to view the history of events that the transaction has gone through.
Transaction Details: Displays the details of the transaction that is opened from the listing page. The tab lists the fields based on the action you click against the transaction.
Events: Displays the history of events that transaction has gone through. The transactions are either acknowledged by the bank or a reporting event is initiated by bank that requires an action to be performed by a corporate user.
In case an action is pending on the corporate user, a Respond button is present against the stated event, that navigates user to screen to perform the respective action.
If you are viewing the transaction details of an amended transaction, you can use the Compare button to see a comparative view of amended transaction (N) and transaction on which amendment was made (N-1).
Additional Information: Lists the 'Attachments' added as part of this transaction and also displays 'Documents' and 'Fees and Charges' details.

section.title: Transfer
section.para: This section describes the Transfer action and the forms it uses.

This can only be done for a Letter of Credit that your company (the main beneficiary) has received notification of, from the Advising Bank. Therefore, this function displays a list of such existing Received Standy Letters of Credit that have not been purged and are transferable. The second beneficiary is guaranteed to receive payment provided he satisfies the terms laid down in the transfer credit, irrespective of the actions of your own company, the main beneficiary. This action sends a message to the Advising Bank, telling them of the transfer.

section.title: Assignment
section.para: This section describes the Assignment action and the forms it uses.

This can only be done for a Received Standby Letter of Credit that your company (the main beneficiary) has received notification of from the Advising Bank. Therefore, this function displays a list of such existing Received Standy Letters of Credit that have not been not purged and are transferable. The second beneficiary is guaranteed to receive payment provided he satisfies the terms laid down in the transfer credit, irrespective of the actions of your own company, the main beneficiary. This action sends a message to the Advising Bank, telling them of the transfer.

Once complete, you can assign part of the proceeds that you expect to receive under an existing Letter of Credit to a second beneficiary. This can only be done for a Letter of Credit that your company (the main beneficiary) has received notification of from the Advising Bank. Therefore, this function displays a list of such existing Received Standy Letters of Credit that have not been not purged and are transferable. The second beneficiary is only paid when your company, the main beneficiary, receives funds under the Letter of Credit. This action sends a message to the Advising Bank, telling them of the assignment.
